text: Damarley Samuels is the captain of Waterhouse F.C. and wears number #18 jersey for the club. He currently holds the record for the first team captain to bring his team to the Red Stripe Premier League final three years in a row. Samuels lives in the community of Daytona in Saint Catherine, Jamaica. Samuels represented Clarendon College in the Dacosta Cup where he was a leading goal scorer during his time. ==Youth career== He attended Greater Portmore High School until he was drafted by the Clarendon College Dacosta Cup Giants where he played alongside players like Andre Blake. He later played for Sporting Central Academy where he became captain after less than a year. ==Career== Samuels currently plays for Waterhouse F.C. where he also became captain after less than a year. == References == *http://jamaica- gleaner.com/gleaner/20140211/sports/sports7.html *https://web.archive.org/web/20170305013618/http://www.jamaicaobserver.com/sport/football/Waterhouse- score-win-on-Patrick-s-return_19234345 *http://jamaica- star.com/article/sports/20151017/patrick-faces-early-test *http://www.blackandredunited.com/dc-united-formations- tactics/2014/8/20/6048043/dc-united-vs-waterhouse-fc-concacaf-champions- league-ccl-romario-campbell-jermaine-anderson Category:Living people Category:People from Saint Catherine Parish Category:Jamaican footballers Category:1990 births Category:Association football midfielders
title: Damarley Samuels
